intro: Dendroviguiera eriophora, commonly known as the silverleaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in the Americas. It has small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a silvery-white powdery coating, which gives it its common name. The plant produces tiny, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Dendroviguiera eriophora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for certain wildlife species.
